title: Inventory of Prompt Files Not Linked in Knowledge Graph

summary.high_level: Identified prompt files in `prompts/` that are not currently represented or referenced in the knowledge graph content.
key_decisions: Treat `scenes/*.json` and `graph/graph.json` as the active graph representation for this inventory.
Capture the prompt gap as a session artifact so future agents can add graph nodes or links deliberately.
changes_made: Scanned prompt files and checked for references in `scenes/*.json` and `graph/graph.json`.

Confirmed all current prompt files are unlinked: `prompts/codex_session_ending_prompt.md`, `prompts/session_archiver_prompt_template.md`, `prompts/session_archiver_prompt_template_copy.md`, `prompts/session_preamble.md`.
Created this session artifact to record the unlinked-prompt inventory.
open_questions: Should prompt files become first-class graph nodes (for example `artifact/*` or `concept/*`) with edges to projects and workflows?
Should `prompts/session_archiver_prompt_template_copy.md` be retained as a separate tracked prompt or consolidated with a single canonical template?

notes_for_future_agents: When new prompt files are added, repeat this check and either link them in scenes or explicitly document why they remain external.
Graph linkage can be minimal: one node per prompt and one edge to a relevant project, pattern, or workflow scene.
